meanings.definition: The state of touching or meeting at a point
meanings.sent1: The tangence of the two lines occurred at the tip of the triangle.
meanings.sent2: The tangence of the circles created a beautiful pattern on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The tangence of the cat's whiskers with the curtain made it look like a whisker curtain!
meanings.sent4: The tangence of their ideas sparked a creative explosion in the room.
meanings.sent5: The tangence of the puzzle pieces made it easy to fit them together.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being tangent
meanings.sent1: The smoothness of the marble surface showed a perfect tangence.
meanings.sent2: The tangence of her argument with the facts made it convincing.
meanings.sent3: His obsession with tangence in design led to some very interesting furniture choices.
meanings.sent4: The tangence of their personalities made them a perfect match.
meanings.sent5: The tangence of colors in the painting created a harmonious blend.

meanings.definition: The act of touching or intersecting
meanings.sent1: The tangence of the two cars caused a minor collision.
meanings.sent2: The tangence of the branches in the wind created a rustling sound.
meanings.sent3: The tangence of the dog's tail with the ball made it impossible to throw.
meanings.sent4: The tangence of their paths in life brought them together unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The tangence of the sun's rays through the leaves created a dappled effect on the ground.
